blocks.content: The Hilbert lattice is irreducible: any element that commutes with all elements must be zero or one. Theorem 14.8.4 of [BeltramettiCassinelli] p. 166. (Contributed by NM, 15-Jun-2006.) (New usage is discouraged.)

blocks.content: The Hilbert lattice is irreducible: any element that commutes with all elements must be zero or one. Theorem 14.8.4 of [BeltramettiCassinelli] p. 166. (Contributed by NM, 16-Jun-2006.) (New usage is discouraged.)
